citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two adult dogs were found with untreated dental disease. Little Cort, an approximately 6-year-old female Dachshund (m/c
# 900217000257313) had excessive tartar build up on her canines, front teeth, and molars. On her right side her upper
canine and upper front teeth were approximately three quarters covered in a hard dark thick brown material. The gumline
on the upper canine was severely recessed with a thick grey creamy discharge. The bottom back teeth are almost
completely covered in a hard dark thick brown material. The gumline slightly recessed with a thick grey creamy discharge.
The gums adjacent to the affected teeth are red and swollen. On the left side the upper canine is about three quarters
covered in a thick, dark brown material with the gum line being slightly recessed. The bottom back tooth is almost
completely covered in a hard dark thick brown material.
Nellie, an approximately one-and-a-half-year-old female Pomeranian (m/c # 900215009873353 had excessive tartar build
up on her molars and marginal buildup on her upper canines and front teeth. On her right side, her upper canine and front
teeth had a moderate buildup of light brown material extending about halfway down the teeth. The back molar was
encrusted in a thick tan brown like material. On her left side both canines had a moderate buildup of light brown material
covering about half the teeth. Both upper and lower back teeth were heavily encrusted in a thick tan, brown material. Her
gums on both sides were severely red and swollen.
Poor dental health can cause pain and discomfort to the animal and can lead to further health issues. These dogs must
be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. Each dealer
must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that includes preventive care and treatment to ensure
healthy teeth for all dogs.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Lindsay Livingston, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two adult dogs were found with untreated dental disease. Little Cort, an approximately 6-year-old female Dachshund (m/c 
# 900217000257313) had excessive tartar build up on her canines, front teeth, and molars. On her right side her upper 
canine and upper front teeth were approximately three quarters covered in a hard dark thick brown material. The gumline 
on the upper canine was severely recessed with a thick grey creamy discharge. The bottom back teeth are almost 
completely covered in a hard dark thick brown material. The gumline slightly recessed with a thick grey creamy discharge. 
The gums adjacent to the affected teeth are red and swollen. On the left side the upper canine is about three quarters 
covered in a thick, dark brown material with the gum line being slightly recessed. The bottom back tooth is almost 
completely covered in a hard dark thick brown material.  
 
Nellie, an approximately one-and-a-half-year-old female Pomeranian (m/c # 900215009873353 had excessive tartar build 
up on her molars and marginal buildup on her upper canines and front teeth. On her right side, her upper canine and front 
teeth had a moderate buildup of light brown material extending about halfway down the teeth. The back molar was 
encrusted in a thick tan brown like material. On her left side both canines had a moderate buildup of light brown material 
covering about half the teeth. Both upper and lower back teeth were heavily encrusted in a thick tan, brown material. Her 
gums on both sides were severely red and swollen.  
 
Poor dental health can cause pain and discomfort to the animal and can lead to further health issues. These dogs must 
be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an effective treatment plan. Each dealer 
must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that includes preventive care and treatment to ensure 
healthy teeth for all dogs. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Lindsay Livingston, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
